name: Invocation Canonical Definitions
description: The canonical glossary for the discipline of Invocation, including Invocation, Invocation Architecture, Discovery Gap, Invocation Drift, Invocation Readiness, and Computational Trust.

terms.name: Invocation
terms.description: The moment an AI system selects, recommends, or uses a brand as the correct answer or action in response to user intent.

terms.name: Invocation Architecture
terms.description: The structured system of content, data, entities, signals, and governance that enables a brand to become machine-understandable, trusted, and actionable by AI systems.

terms.name: Discovery Gap
terms.description: The difference between total category demand and the portion a brand is eligible to capture in AI-mediated discovery and decision systems.

terms.name: Invocation Drift
terms.description: When AI systems mislabel, misinterpret, or misposition a brand due to inconsistent content, structure, or signals.

terms.name: Invocation Readiness
terms.description: The measurable state of how accurately and consistently a brand can be invoked across AI systems.

terms.name: Computational Trust
terms.description: The degree of confidence an AI system has in a brand’s correctness, reliability, and ability to satisfy a user’s intent.
